content.description: Straight up the face of Big Godson above the small tulip poplar tree growing out of the rock. Lots of great sidepulls and pinches. You're doing it right if you're straddling the tree on the way up. Don't fall on the tree or you might lose some reproductive capacity. The Tree of Life giveth and it taketh away.
content.location: Start at the tree and go straight up the face. Vertical cracks on the left side afford some nice pinches.

content.description: A blast. Can be a bit mossy and sharp on bare feet. Mind the slabbiness and kick off the wall if you're starting to fall.
content.location: Start right of the small tulip poplar tree growing out of the rock with hands matched on the juggy crack. Ascend up and to the left on the slab. Finish to the left on the face. Add a grade of difficulty if climbing barefoot. This is the climb you would do if you were looking for the easiest way up the face.
